children.name: manager
children.definition: someone whose job is to be in charge of a group of people, a project, a department, or a bank, shop, hotel etc:
examples: quản lí ( một công ty, một bộ phận, một dự án, công việc kinh doanh )
▪ I’d like to speak to the manager.
Tôi muốn nói chuyện vói quản lí
manager of: quản lí về cái gì
▪ the advertising manager of a mail-order company
Quan lí quảng cáo của công ty đặt hàng qua thư
bank/hotel/restaurant etc manager: giám đốc ngân hàng/ khách sạn
▪ All new loans must be approved by the bank manager.
Tát cả nhungwng khoản vay cần được tán thành bởi quản lí ngân hàng
marketing/sales/accounts etc manager: quản lí marketing/bán hàng/tài khoản
▪ She’s one of our regional sales managers.
Cô ấy là một trong những giám đốc bán hàng
manager/ˈmænɪdʒəʳ/ [countable noun] someone whose job is to run part or all of a company or other organization and who is in charge of you at work:
quản lý
▪ He was a manager for Safeway Stores before leaving to start his own business.
▪ If the sales clerk cannot help you, ask to see the manager.
▪ McBride was a general manager in charge of research and development.
line managerthe person who is directly in charge of your work quản lý, điều hành
▪ Notify your line manager if you are ill.
managernoun[ C ] người chỉ đạo; giám đốc
the person who is responsible for managing an organization
_a bank manager
_a station manager
_the production manager
_I wish to speak to the manager.
line managernoun
one of the managers who are responsible for the most important activities of a largecompany, such as production

children.name: boss
children.definition: the person who is in charge of you at work:
examples: xếp, quản lý
▪ Does your boss know you’re looking for another job?
Xếp bạn có biết bạn đanng tìm coog việc khác không?
▪ There’s a new guy at work who’s always trying to impress the boss.
Nhân viên mới luôn luôn tạo ấn tượng với xếp
▪ The front page of the paper announced ‘Company bosses get record pay increases’.
Trang đầu của một tờ báo nó rằng" Những giám đốc công ty sẽ được tăng lương kỉ luc"
boss/bɒsǁbɔːs/ [countable noun] the person who is in charge of you at work: ông chủ
▪ As a secretary, my job includes taking my boss’s phone calls.
▪ She accuses her former boss of sexually harassing her.
immediate bossthe person who is directly in charge of you chủ trực tiếp
▪ The managing director is a man but my immediate boss is a woman.
be your own bossto run your own business and organize your own work tự làm chủ
▪ I don’t make as much money as I used to, but I prefer being my own boss.
bossnoun[ C ]MANAGER ông chủ, thủ trưởngông trùm
the person who is in charge of an organization and who tells others what to do
_She was the boss of a large international company.
_I started up my own business and now I'm myownboss (= I work for myself and no one tells me what to do) .
_informalWho's the boss (= the person who makes all the important decisions) in your house?

children.name: foreman
children.definition: someone who is in charge of a group of factory workers or builders, whose job is to make sure that the workers do what the manager wants:
examples: quản đôc , đốc công
▪ Anton hated the foreman, who was never satisfied with anyone’s work.
Anto ghét quản đốc của anh ta, người khoog bao giờ hài lòng với bất kì công việc của ai
foreman of: quản đốc của....
▪ He spoke as though he were a rich landowner instead of just the foreman of a modest building firm.
Anh ấy nói như thể là anh ta là một nhà giàu có chứ khong phải là nhà thầu xây dựng
foreman/ˈfɔːʳmən/ [countable noun] someone who is in charge of a group of factory workers or builders and is responsible for seeing that orders from managers are carried out: quản lý, quản đốc
▪ Time taken in unloading should be recorded by the foreman and paid at the agreed rate.
foremannoun[ C ]PERSON AT WORK quản đốc;đốc công
specialized a skilled person with experience who is in charge of and watches over a group of workers

children.name: supervisor
children.definition: someone who is in charge of a group of workers, such as cleaners or secretaries, in an office, factory, airport etc, whose job is to make sure that the workers do what the manager wants:
examples: giám sát viên
▪ We still need to replace the office supervisor.
Chúng tôi cần thay đổi giám sát viên van phòng
supervisor of: giám sát viên của
▪ She has worked her way up the company and is now supervisor of 50 staff members.
Cô ấy làm việc theo cách của mình ở công ty va bây giờ là giám sat viên của 50 nhân viên
supervisor/ˈsuːpəʳvaɪzəʳ, ˈsjuː-ǁˈsuː-/ [countable noun] someone who is in charge of a group of workers, and makes sure they do their jobs properly:
người quản lí, giám sát
▪ You must receive approval from a supervisor before visiting a high-risk area.
▪ Haworth, formerly a supervisor of 120 people at a printing company, left to start his own business.
supervisornoun[ C ] người giám sát; người giám thị
a person whose job is tosupervisesomeone or something
supervisornoun[ C ] người giám sát; người giám thị
a person whose job is tosupervisesomeone or something

children.name: chairman/chairwoman
children.definition: the person who is in charge of alargecompany , especially the most powerful member of itsboard:
examples: chủ tịch ( một công ty lớn )
▪Doreen’s leaving party looked more like a board meeting, with the chairman and directors there to say goodbye.
Buổi tiệc chia tay của Doreen trong giống như một cuộc họp cổ đông với sự tham gia của chủ tịch và giám đốc
chairman/chairwoman of : Chủ tịch của
▪ Manley gradually worked her way up, and within ten years became chairwoman of the board.
Manley đã tự mình làm việc và trong vòng 10 năm đã trở thành chủ tịch của bộ
▪ The Chairman of British Airways visited Downing Street last week.
Chủ tịch của đường hàng không đã tham quan Dowingstreet vào tuần rước

children.name: chief executive officer
children.definition: chief executivealsochiefexecutiveofficer/CEOAmerican   the manager withmostauthorityin the normal, everyday management of a company. This job is often combined with other jobs, such as that ofpresident:
examples: giám đốc điều hành ( thường thì chức này được nắm giữ bởi chủ tịch )
▪ Universal Studios is looking for a new chief executive.
Universal Studio đang tiềm kiếm một giám đóc điều hanh mới
chief executive of:
▪ the CEO of General Motors:
Giam đốc của General Motors
chief executive officernoun[ C ] (abbreviationCEO)Giám đốc điều hành
the person with the most important position in a company
CEOnoun[ C ] Giám đốc điều hành
abbreviation forchief executive officer : the person with the most important position in a company

children.name: president
children.definition: the person in charge of alargecompany,especially in the US:
examples: chủ tịch ( của một công ty lớn đặc biệt là ở Mỹ )
▪ Angry shareholders called for the resignation of the company preside
Cổ đông công ty Angry kêu gọi sự từ chức của chủ tịch
president of: Chủ tịch của cái gì
▪ the president of CBS new
Chủ tịch của đài CBS
presidentnoun[ C ]ORGANIZATION chủ tịch
the person who has the highest position in an organization or, especially in theUS, in a company
_a former President of the Royal Society
_mainly USShe's a friend of the presidentofthe bank.

children.name: managing director
children.definition: Britishthe person in charge of thedailymanagement of acompanyororganization. This job is often combined with that ofchairman:
examples: giám đốc điều hành ( thường thì chức này được nắm giữ bởi chủ tịch )
managing director of: giám đốc quản li của..
▪ Silva has been appointed managing director of the sales division.
Silva được tiến cử cho vị trí giám đốc quản lí bán hàng
▪ He’s the managing director of a small printing firm.
Anh ấy là giám đốc quản lí của văn phòng nghệ thuật quy mô nhỏ
managing directornoun[ C ] (abbreviationMD)UK giám đốc điều hành
the person in charge of the way a company operates
_There's a board of five directors, but she is the Managing Director.
_You should talk to the MD about your proposal.

children.name: chief operating officer
children.definition: (alsochief operations officer) noun  (abbrCOO) a person who is employed to manage the daily affairs of a company, usually under the authority of a chief executive officer

children.name: a manager who is in a lower position
deputy
children.definition: someone who is immediately below the rank of anothermanager, and who is officially in charge when that other person is away or ill:
examples: phó
deputy director/manager/principal etc giám đốc đại diện
▪ The deputy director is authorized to act in the director’s absence.
Giám đốc đại diện có quyền quyêt định thay cho giám đốc khi nghỉ phép
▪ He became the deputy head of the FBI at the age of only 36.
Anh ấy trở thành giám đốc đại dện của FBI chiwr ở độ tuổi 36

children.name: second-in-command
children.definition: a manager who is in charge of anorganizationordepartmentwhen a more senior manager is not there:

children.name: phó
examples: ▪ I left the planning to my second- in-command while I was away.
▪ She had been second- in-command at the nursing home and was now a senior manager in one of the big Boston hospitals.

children.name: executive directors top executives senior executives
director
children.definition: an important manager who is in charge of adepartmentin a company:
examples: giám đốc ( 1 bộ phận công ty lớn, thành viên của ban quản trị )
▪ The directors are meeting today to discuss the company’s future
Những người giám đốc hôm nay sẽ họp để thảo luận về tương lai của công ty
finance/sales/personnel etc director:
Giám đốc tài chính/ bán hàng/ nhân viên
▪ Have you met the new finance director?
Bạn đã gặp giám đốc tài chính mới chưa?
director of: Giám đốc của
▪ Dr Jane Wilde, director of the Health Promotion Agency
Bác sĩ Jane Wide, giám đốc của cục tăng cường sức khỏe
chief financial officer(alsochieffinanceofficer) noun [C] (abbrCFO) the person in charge of the financial department of a company

chief operating officer(alsochief operations officer) noun [C] (abbrCOO) a person who is employed to manage the daily affairs of a company, usually under the authority of a chief executive officer Copyright Oxford University Press 2005

children.name: executive
children.definition: a manager, especially an important one:
examples: ủy viên ban quản trị
▪ We were visited by a young, dynamic executive from a small computer company.
Chúng tôi được thăm hỏi bởi một nhân viên trẻ, năng động từ công ty máy tính quy mô nhỏ
executive for: ủy vieenveef cái gì
▪ Clifford, a former congressman, is now an executive for a large charity.
Clifford, một cựu nghị sĩ Mỹ bây giờ là ủy viên ban quản trị cho nhà từ thiện lớn
executive stress : căng thẳng hành chính
an illness suffered by managers who are under a lot of pressure in their jobs
▪ a psychiatrist who specializes in executive stress
Một nhà tâm lí học chuyên về thực chữa trị cang thẳng hành chính
executivenoun[ C ] uỷ viên ban chấp hành, uỷ viên ban quản trị
(informalexec) someone in a high position, especially inbusiness,who makes decisions and puts them into action
_She is now aseniorexecutive, having worked her way up through the company.

children.name: head
children.definition: /hed/  the person in charge of anorganizationordepartment:
examples: người đứng đầu ( 1 công ty, 1 tổ chức )
trưởng phòng ( 1 phòng ban )
head of
▪the former head of MI5, the British Intelligence Service
trưởng phòng MI5 của cơ quan tình báo Anh
▪ She’s the head of research and development.
Cô ấy là trưởng phòng nghiên cứu và phát triển
head/hed/ [countable noun] the person who is in charge of a company, department, or particular activity:
người đứng đầu
head of người đứng đầu của
▪ According to Rice, the head of the planning committee, the project is 25% completed.
be head of something người đứng đầu của gì đó
▪ Hwang is head of the local Communist Party, and is also a farmer.
headnounLEADER người đứng đầu; người chỉ huy; thủ trưởng
[ C ] someone in charge of or leading an organization, group, etc
_the head of the History department
_the head chef

children.name: vice president
children.definition: American abbreviationVP the person in acompanyororganizationwho is directly below the president in rank, and who is usually responsible for aparticularpartof the company:
examples: phó chủ tịch ( bộ phận nào đó )
▪ Meyer hopes to become the company’s first female vice president.
Meyer hy vọng trở thành nữ phó chủ tich đầu tiên của công ty
vice president of/for: Phó chủ tịch của...
▪ the vice president for sales and marketing
Phó chủ tịch của nhân viên và marketing
▪ the VP of corporate affairs
Phó chủ tịch các vấn đề hợp tác
vice presidentnoun[ C ] phó chủ tịch
USthe person who is responsible for a large important part of a company ororganization
_She's vice president of sales and marketing.

children.name: founder
children.definition: noun người thành lập; người sáng lập

children.name: someone who establishes an organization
examples: _She is the founder and managing director of the company.

children.name: sb who can make decisions or not
non-executive
children.definition: adjective used to describe sb who is not employed by a company but takes part in meetings of the board of directors and gives independent advice:
examples: ko thuộc ban quản trị ( cố vấn )
She works for a television company in a non-executive role.
a non-executive board member/chairperson/officer
a non-executive committee/panel

children.definition: executive// adjective
examples: 1 connected with managing a business or an organization, and with making plans and decisions:
She has an executive position in a finance company.
the executive management team
executive decisions/duties/jobs/positions
executive bonuses/pay/perks
2 having the power to put important laws and decisions into effect; connected with this:
The executive board have approved the redundancies. He sits on the board but has no executive power.
an executive board/committee/officer

3 for the use of sb who is important; expensive and of good quality: the executive lounge (= at an airport) What has been happening in the company\sis executive suite (= the offices used by the senior managers)? an executive jet/lounge/suite executive cars/housing Copyright Oxford University Press 2005
executiveadjective[ before noun ] châp hành; quản trị
relating to making decisions and managing businesses, or suitable for people with important jobs in business
_His executive skills will be very useful to the company.
_executive cars
_an executive suite

children.name: management
children.definition: the people who are in charge of an organization, not the ordinary workers:
examples: ban quản trị, ban điều hành
▪ Talks between the workers and the management broke down today.
Cuộc nói chuyện giữa công nhân và ban quản lí đã thất bại
senior management: Ban quản trị cấp cao
▪ Senior management seem to be completely out of touch with their staff’s needs.
Dường như ban quản trị cấp cao hoàn toàn đề câp đến nhu cầu nhân viên
managementnoun ban quản lý;ban quản đốc;ban quản trị
[ C + singular or plural verb ]the group of people responsible for controlling and organizing a company
_Management has/have offered staff a 3% pay increase.

children.name: the board/the board of directors
children.definition: the group of people who have been chosen to manage a company, and who meet regularly to make important decisions:
examples: hội đồng quản trị
▪ There are only two women on the company’s board of directors.
Chỉ có hai người phụ nữ trong ban hội đồng quản trị của công ty
▪ Last year the board approved use of funds to improve staff training.
Năm ngoái ban quan trị ủng hộ viêc dùng tiền quỷ để đào tạo nhân viên
be appointed to the board (of directors) : được bổ nhiệm vào ban quản trị
▪ Carmichael was appointed to the board in July.
Carmichael được bổ nhiệm làm họi đồng quản trị vào thang bảy
board meeting: Cuộc họp hội đồng quản trị
▪ An emergency board meeting was hastily arranged.
Cuộc họp khẩn cấp hội đồng quản trị đã được sắp xếp một cách vôi vã
boardnounPEOPLE ban;uỷ ban; hội đồng;bộ
[ C usually singular + singular or plural verb ]
the group of people who are responsible for controlling and organizing a company or organization
_Every decision has to be passed bytheboard(of directors).
_She started in the firm by making the tea and now she'son theboard/a boardmember
_Theboardof governorsmeet/meets once a month to discuss school policy.

children.name: head office
children.definition: British /the head officeAmerican   the group of top managers of a company who work in it’scentraloffice and control the rest of the company’s offices from there:

children.name: trụ sở chính, cơ quan đầu não ( ý nói tất cả những quản lý cấp cao trong đó )
examples: ▪ Head office must approve any order for new equipment.

children.name: Trụ sở chính phải ủng hộ đơn đặt hàng trang thiết bị mới
examples: ▪ In the past, strategy was dictated by the head office.

children.name: Trong quá khứ, chiến lược này được đề ra bởi trụ sở chính
the powers that be
children.definition: an expression meaning the management of an organization, used especially when the organization is solargethat you donot know who the managementis:

children.name: những người có thẩm quyền ( của 1 công ty tổ chức lớn, dùng khi bạn ko biết họ là ai )
examples: ▪ The powers that be have decided that our lunch breaks should be reduced to 45 minutes.

children.name: Những ngưỡi có thẩm quyền đã quyết định giờ nghỉ trưa của chúng tôi được giảm xuống còn 45 phút
executive directors top executives senior executives
finance director
children.definition: director  an important manager who is in charge of adepartmentin a company:
examples: giám đốc ( 1 bộ phận công ty lớn, thành viên của ban quản trị )
▪ The directors are meeting today to discuss the company’s future
Những người giám đốc hôm nay sẽ họp để thảo luận về tương lai của công ty
finance/marketing/sales/personnel/human resources/IT/research etc director:
▪ Have you met the new finance director?
Bạn đã gặp giám đốc tài chính mới chưa?
director of financefinance/marketing/sales/personnel/human resources/IT/research etc : Giám đốc của
finance director of ...
▪ Dr Jane Wilde, finance director of the Health Promotion Agency
Bác sĩ Jane Wide, giám đốc của cục tăng cường sức khỏe

children.name: executive
children.definition: a manager, especially an important one:
examples: ủy viên ban quản trị
▪ We were visited by a young, dynamic executive from a small computer company.
Chúng tôi được thăm hỏi bởi một nhân viên trẻ, năng động từ công ty máy tính quy mô nhỏ
executive for: ủy vieenveef cái gì
▪ Clifford, a former congressman, is now an executive for a large charity.
Clifford, một cựu nghị sĩ Mỹ bây giờ là ủy viên ban quản trị cho nhà từ thiện lớn
executive stress : căng thẳng hành chính
an illness suffered by managers who are under a lot of pressure in their jobs
▪ a psychiatrist who specializes in executive stress
Một nhà tâm lí học chuyên về thực chữa trị cang thẳng hành chính
executivenoun[ C ] uỷ viên ban chấp hành, uỷ viên ban quản trị
(informalexec) someone in a high position, especially inbusiness,who makes decisions and puts them into action
_She is now aseniorexecutive, having worked her way up through the company.

children.name: vice president
children.definition: American abbreviationVP the person in acompanywho is directly below thepresidentin rank, and who is usually responsible for aparticularpartof the company:
examples: phó chủ tịch ( bộ phận nào đó )
▪ Meyer hopes to become the company’s first female vice president.
Meyer hy vọng trở thành nữ phó chủ tich đầu tiên của công ty
vice president of/for: Phó chủ tịch của...
▪ the vice president for sales and marketing
Phó chủ tịch của nhân viên và marketing
▪ the VP of corporate affairs
Phó chủ tịch các vấn đề hợp tác
vice presidentnoun[ C ] phó chủ tịch
USthe person who is responsible for a large important part of a company ororganization
_She's vice president of sales and marketing.

children.name: head of finance
children.definition: head/hed/  the person in charge of andepartment:
examples: trưởng phòng( bộ phận nào đó )
head offinance/marketing/sales/personnel/human resources/IT/research etc
▪ She’s the head of research and development.
Cô ấy là trưởng phòng nghiên cứu và phát triển

children.name: chief financial officer
children.definition: (alsochieffinanceofficer) noun  (abbrCFO) the person in charge of the financial department of a company

children.name: leadership
children.definition: the people in charge of a political party or country:

children.name: ban lãnh đạo
examples: ▪ Party members had lost confidence in the leadership.
▪ Turkey has lacked any clear leadership since the collapse of the coalition government four months ago.

children.name: leadership of ban lãnh đạo của
examples: ▪ The leadership of the Association was criticized for not making its plans more easily accessible.

children.name: employer
children.definition: the person, company, or organization that you work for:
examples: ông chủ , chủ lao động ( có thể là người, tổ chức, công ty )
▪ We will need a reference from your last employer before we can send you a contract.
Chúng tôi sẽ cần một giấy giới thiệu từ chủ lao động cũ của bạn trước khi chúng tôi có thể đưa cho bạn 1 hợp đồng
▪ She applied to her employer for a redundancy payment, but she was refused.
employernoun[ C ] chủ;người sử dụng lao động
a person or organization that employs people
_We need a reference from your former employer.

children.name: partner
children.definition: noun người chung phần; cộng sự; đối tác

children.name: one of the owners of a company
examples: _He's a partnerinan insurance company/a law firm.

children.name: superior
children.definition: someone who is in a higher position than you at work:

children.name: cấp trên
examples: ▪ The report he submitted to his superiors accurately reflected the poor morale of the workers.

children.name: immediate superiorthe person in the position directly above you cấp trên trực tiếp
examples: ▪ Your most important working relationship is with your immediate superior.

children.name: directorship
children.definition: noun chức giám đốc

children.name: the position of being thedirectorof a company
examples: _He holds several company directorships.

children.name: boss
children.definition: the person who is in charge of you at work:
examples: xếp ( người )
▪ Does your boss know you’re looking for another job?
Xếp bạn có biết bạn đanng tìm coog việc khác không?
▪ There’s a new guy at work who’s always trying to impress the boss.
Nhân viên mới luôn luôn tạo ấn tượng với xếp
▪ The front page of the paper announced ‘Company bosses get record pay increases’.
Trang đầu của một tờ báo nó rằng" Những giám đốc công ty sẽ được tăng lương kỉ luc"
bossnoun[ C ]MANAGER ông chủ, thủ trưởngông trùm
the person who is in charge of an organization and who tells others what to do
_She was the boss of a large international company.
_I started up my own business and now I'm myownboss (= I work for myself and no one tells me what to do) .
_informalWho's the boss (= the person who makes all the important decisions) in your house?

children.name: general
children.definition: adjectiveNOT LIMITED tổng
examples: used as part of the title of a job of someone who is in charge of a whole organization or company
_the generalmanager tổng giám đốc
_the General Secretary of the UN

children.name: sb's line manager
children.definition: line manager  the manager who is directly in charge of you in a company, rather than a more senior manager:
examples: cấp trên
▪ If you want to take a holiday, first ask your line manager.
Nếu bạn muốn đi nghĩ, bạn phải hỏi nhà quản lí dây chuyên trước đã
sb'sline manager
mainly UK someone who is responsible for managing someone else in a company or business

children.name: report to
children.definition: if you report to someone in a company, they are your line manager:
examples: là cấp dưới của ...
▪ Jan is based in Birmingham and reports to the Head of Marketing.
Jan dựa vào Birmingham và báo cáo với giám đốc Marketing
report tosbphrasal verb
Someone you report to at work is the person in authority over you who gives you tasks and checks that you do them
_You will report directly to the boss.

children.name: senior
children.definition: nounHIGH RANK nhân viên, quanchứccấp cao

children.name: manager
children.definition: someone whose job is to be in charge of a department
examples: quản lí ( một bộ phận )
manager of: quản lí về cái gì
▪ the advertising manager of a mail-order company
Quan lí quảng cáo của công ty đặt hàng qua thư
marketing/sales/accounts etc manager: quản lí marketing/bán hàng/tài khoản
▪ She’s one of our regional sales managers.
Cô ấy là một trong những giám đốc bán hàng
line managerthe person who is directly in charge of your work
quản lý, điều hành
▪ Notify your line manager if you are ill.
managernoun[ C ] người chỉ đạo; giám đốc
the person who is responsible for managing an organization
_a bank manager
_a station manager
_the production manager
_I wish to speak to the manager.
line managernoun
one of the managers who are responsible for the most important activities of a largecompany, such as production

children.name: line manager
children.definition: the person who is directly in charge of your work

children.name: quản lý, điều hành
examples: ▪ Notify your line manager if you are ill.
